page.title: 20Ladock Woods 2.
page.content:
Ladock Wood is owned by The Duchy of Cornwall. The trees that are grown come from North America:{Douglas Fir, {Western Hemlock, Norway Spruce and {Larch.}When they are planted thay are two years old and they are planted in a{fifty year rotation. When the trees are cut down they are lifted by a crane and put onto a tractor and trailer which takes the wood to Lostwithiel Sawmill. The wood is sold to make{fencing stakes, gates {and farm buildings.
A lot of activities go on in the woods like{orienteering, bird {watching, searching for butterflies {and fungi.}There is also{pheasant {shooting}and{horse riding.}The public are allowed to walk around in the woods as long as they keep to the {forest trail}which has just been made.
